page.title: 08The village ghost, Plumtree
page.content: Bradley's Yard, once a farmyard, but now a small housing development, is haunted by the ghost of a farmworker who hanged himself in the 19th century. The yard, tucked away by the Church and rectory, now contains the original farmhouse, a converted barn and several modern houses. The man is said to have committed suicide in the barn and his ghost can be seen crossing the yard at dawn during the winter months. One of the villagers who, until recently, delivered the milk, reports that although she saw the ghost cross her path on many occasions, she felt no threat or malice from him. She describes him as a "friendly" ghost.
